thread.title: Central Alberta storefront ‘obliterated’ by pickup truck in ATM theft attempt: RCMP
thread.title_full: Central Alberta storefront ‘obliterated’ by pickup truck in ATM theft attempt: RCMP

author: Phil Heidenreich
title: Central Alberta storefront ‘obliterated’ by pickup truck in ATM theft attempt: RCMP
text:
Listen 
The RCMP said it is looking for two men they believe rammed a pickup truck into a storefront in Whitecourt, Alta. early Wednesday morning in an attempt to steal an automated teller machine. 
According to police, a black Ford F-150 crashed into the front of a convenience store in the 3700 block of Kepler Street shortly after 4 a.m. They said the vehicle was driven “back and forth inside the store several times” and that much of the storefront was “obliterated” as a result. However, police said the theft attempt was not successful. 
Police investigate after a black Ford F-150 crashed into the front of a convenience store in Whitecourt, Alta. shortly after 4 a.m. On Feb. 1, 2017. COURTESY: Whitecourt RCMP 
Police investigate after a black Ford F-150 crashed into the front of a convenience store in Whitecourt, Alta. shortly after 4 a.m. On Feb. 1, 2017. COURTESY: Whitecourt RCMP 
Police investigate after a black Ford F-150 crashed into the front of a convenience store in Whitecourt, Alta. shortly after 4 a.m. On Feb. 1, 2017. COURTESY: Whitecourt RCMP 
Mounties said the pickup truck, which they believe was stolen, was found “torched” later in the morning. 
According to police, both men involved in the break and enter were wearing gloves and masks.
